page.title: 02POPULATION OF SOUTH INVERKIP
page.content: Apart from the south of{Inverkip}which has around one thousand people living in it, the rest of the area to the south west of Greenock is sparsely populated. However there are a few farms and a large hotel which together have a{population}of about 50 people. The farm houses will be between one and two hundred years old. Most of the farms will be rented from Sir Houston Shaw Stuart, the owner of Ardgowan Estate which covers most of the area. Most farms are dairy or stock rearing. The houses in the south of Inverkip are mainly modern detached bungalows. These are owner occupied and are ten to twenty years old. The bungalows are made of brick and roughcast with slate roofs.
